results.title: The Afternoon house
results.brief_description: An experimental film showing the fascination of an old house and its garden for a small girl. She goes there to retrieve a lost ball, and wanders about looking at the trees and flowers first, and then going through the Georgian doorway and up the staircase exploring the rooms, looking at the pictures, trying an old fashioned cane chair and then, becoming engrossed in her surroundings, she knocks over a vase of daisies and is frightened as she sees ugly masks staring at her from the walls. She dashes downstairs and out the gate without stopping even to retrieve her ball. Photographed by Mike Browning, music by Allan Lee.

results.title: Aftermath: the defence against disaster
results.brief_description: Civil defense workers carry no guns. Their job is to help where tragedy has become personal reality. This film shows the activities, training and operations of civil defence organisations in Australia. The film is designed to assist in training civil defence recruits in all States and to widen appreciation of the need for civil defence preparedness among the general public in times of both peace and war. Adapted from the film “Aftermath” by Film Australia for the Natural Disasters Organization. No other credits available.

results.title: After the miracle
results.brief_description: A broad view of life in Israel in 1966. Covers economic and social development and some problems; the settling of millions of immigrants, the continuous threat of invasion, the lack of natural resources. Discusses the active and varied religious and political life, and the advanced state of science and technology

results.title: After the Flood
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Based on the Brisbane floods of 1974, this film is designed to illustrate to social workers the long- term effects of natural disaster on people in need of help

results.title: After the First
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Frangakis, Karl Holtsnider and Teleketics
results.brief_description: An open-ended film which explores a young boy’s emotions throughout his first hunting trip. Describes how the boy’s initial excitement, his mother’s concern and his father’s impatient pride all come together at the climactic moment of the killing. Designed to promote discussion on violence, fathers and sons, ecology, growing up and social conditioning. Designed to promote discussion on violence, fathers and sons, ecology, growing up and social conditioning.

results.title: After Proust
results.creator_credit: Christopher McGill, John Baxter and Galadriel Films
results.brief_description: A fleeting encounter between a man and a woman is treated in a romantic fashion. Set in Edwardian Sydney, the film is intended to suggest the atmosphere of the period and the narrative style of Marcel Proust.

results.title: After prison, what?
results.creator_credit: Ronald Weyman, Sydney Newman and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Portrays the difficulties experienced by a man who wants to go straight but is unable to get work because he has a prison record. Day after day Charles Brown answers the want ads but employers will not hire an ex-convict. Doubts and fears beset him - he is sincere in his desire to work at the trade he learned in the penitentiary and yet society will not trust him. Eventually, before he falls into his old ways, the John Howard Society secures a job for him where he can take his place in society and regain his self-respect. Film award: Canadian Film Awards.

results.title: After Cook
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A look at the Australian people, their character, attitudes, and way of life. Australians, in the city and the bush, are examined both at home and while enjoying their favourite pastimes. Note: A short version of 28 minutes, intended mainly for overseas viewers, was also produced, entitled ‘Everything under the sun. Commentator: John Meillon.
